page.title: 01LECHLADE-LOCATION
page.content: {WHERE IS IT?}Lechlade is on the River Thames. It is a small town in Gloucestershire, close to the borders of Oxfordshire and Wiltshire. {ROADS.}From London travel along the M4 and turn off at Swindon. Continue along the A345, join the A417 and then along the A361 through Highworth, then into Lechlade. {FEATURES}The main features are the {River Thames}and the fifteenth century {Church of St. Lawrence,}re-named by {Catherine of Aragon,}one time resident of the{Manor House,}as well as a number of fine old houses. Follow {Shelley's Walk,}the path through the churchyard named after the poet who penned his Stanzas there in 1815 and you arrive at the school. Lechlade is a popular tourist spot because boating on the Thames begins there and it is within easy reach of the{Cotswolds.
